body.p: Some distributions like Debian do already have versions of the FusionInventory agent in their distribution repositories - But they are more lilkely being older or even quite outdated.
The FusionInventory developers maintain a up-to-date DEB-Package of the most recent version in a extra repository. If you want to use it, you have to edit the following file:
Add the following line: deb http://debian.fusioninventory.org/debian/ stable main
List all the FusionInventory packages available:
You will have to install the agent then with the command apt-get install to install the FusionInventory agent and its modules onto a machine.
